headline.main: New, Simple ‘Buy’ Buttons Aim to Entice Mobile Shoppers
headline.print_headline: Getting to ‘Buy,’ on Mobile

docs.abstract: Number of companies are introducing simple 'buy' buttons in order to capitalize on amount of time consumers spend browsing Internet on mobile phones; despite growing use of mobile, consumers are far more inclined to use desktop computers to make online purchases; buy buttons will allow companies like Facebook, Google and Twitter to reap more benefits from mobile ad operations.

docs.snippet: Stephen Joseph first sued in San Francisco over graffiti. He lost, but the city cleaned up the graffiti. His latest victory is trans fats. He has learned that you can lose in court, but carry the day....
docs.lead_paragraph: Stephen Joseph first sued in San Francisco over graffiti. He lost, but the city cleaned up the graffiti. His latest victory is trans fats. He has learned that you can lose in court, but carry the day.

headline.main: When This Man Is Irked, He Might Just File a Suit
headline.print_headline: When This Man Is Irked, He Might Just File a Suit

docs.abstract: Public interest lawyer Stephen L Joseph has filed suit against tech companies Apple, Google, Microsoft and Samsung claiming that their smartphones and other devices encourage people to engage in deadly habit of distracted driving; ban of trans fats that will go into effect in 2018 is mark of how Joseph's sometimes quixotic suits can yield fruit, as he was first to turn issue into legal battle when he successfully sued Kraft Foods in 2003 to eliminate those fats from Oreo cookies.

headline.main: Uber Out of the Running for Here, Nokia’s Digital Mapping Service

docs.abstract: Uber is said to abandon plans to acquire Here, mapping unit of Nokia that is main competitor to Google Maps; consortium of German automobile manufacturers appears to be trying to reach deal with Nokia, and has increasingly taken tougher negotiating stance as other suitors have dropped out of running.

headline.main: Windows 10 Signifies Microsoft’s Shift in Strategy
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Shifts Its Strategy

docs.abstract: Microsoft does not plan to charge customers for upgrading to new Windows 10 operating system in sign of how tech industry has changed; company once charged anywhere from $50 to $100 for upgrades, but model has been made obsolete by rise of companies like Google, which offer free software and services; Microsoft's core business remains software, but it has begun to prioritize expanding its user and developer base.

docs.snippet: Facebook and other companies have struggled with how wearers of the device could have a good experience with their apps tailored to a small screen....

headline.main: Apple Waits as App Developers Study Who’s Buying Its Watch
headline.print_headline: Apple Waits as App Developers Study Who’s Buying Its Watch

docs.abstract: Investors, tech followers, analysts and app developers are eager to see what Apple's next earnings report has to say about market for the Apple Watch; outcome will affect degree to which companies focus on creating watch-friendly apps; Facebook, Snapchat and Google have yet to produce Apple Watch apps, which would in turn make consumers more likely to buy the product.

docs.abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column points out Google's hiring of respected Morgan Stanley executive Ruth Porat as chief financial officer is viewed as sign of maturity at company; notes that day after hiring Porat, Google shares added about $60 billion in market capitalization.
